data.title: Can You Be Friends With Your Coworkers?

data.text:
Hold on before you dismiss this idea. Let me explain. We often connect with people at work. We all know someone who’s got our back, and it feels great. Some might even feel like kindred spirits, and they probably are.

I can’t overstate how much my work friends meant to me; the benefits were countless. It was refreshing to have allies to share concerns and work through issues. Plus, it made the job more enjoyable. As an Executive Coach, I actively build relationships because being a solopreneur can be isolating. Ask Boomers, Gen X, and Gen Y; they’ll tell you they’ve made lifelong friends at work. They attended personal events and stayed in touch after leaving their jobs.

Having ‘allies’ at work promotes a sense of belonging and improved well-being. I agree 100%. However, being too ‘chummy’ with your work friends can backfire. Why? The workplace has undergone significant changes since the pandemic.
